channel.title: [All] Advanced Shop Editor (Super Easy GUI - Edit everything in a shop)
channel.description:
[CENTER][U][size=16pt]Introduction[/size][/U][/CENTER] Hello moparscape members. I have finally completed a project (Shop Editor) and am releasing it on here free to use. I don't want anyone to post this anywhere else without my consent, which is why the program itself links to this thread. Please do not post any suggestions/bugs with the program in this thread. I have spent quite a bit of work on this and would definitely appreciate a thanks or any constructive comments. [Also posted on rune-server under the user "mattsforeal"]
[CENTER][size=14pt][U]Basic Features[/U][/size][/CENTER] [B]Setting Up:[/B] After you have downloaded and extracted the application and its configuration folder you will be able to open it up and start browsing for your server. Please take note that the configuration folder MUST be in the same directory as the application for this program to work properly. Go ahead and open it.
[IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/8zimpg.png[/img]
Browse for the configuration folder of your server and hit OK.
[U]The editor uses the following files:[/U] • [B]items.cfg[/B] - This tells the editor what ids and item names match up with an item in the shop. • [B]shops.cfg[/B] - This is the list of shops the shop editor is going to be changing. • [B]prices.txt[/B] - This is the file any price changes to items are going to be saved in format "ITEMID PRICE" [I]Note: Not all servers use prices.txt for item prices, if that is the case the editor will create the file and save the prices there anyway.[/I]
[B]Selecting a shop and item:[/B] Simply scroll through the list for the shop you want to edit and click on it to view the shop. From here you can move, delete, add, or change amount or value of an item by clicking on an item in the shop.
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2yjstxg.png[/img]
Continuing on you can add items to the shop, all you have to do is select an item and click add before or add after. A dialogue will pop up allowing you to search for items to add to the shop.
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2yyyww3.png[/img]
Double click the item you searched for to add it on Que. If you wish to remove an item from the Que list just double click on that.
[IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/eia7w9.jpg[/img]
When you think you are done with your shop click the "Hot Pink" Save button in the top right hand corner. The application will also prompt if you would like to save when you close it.
[IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/2m859uo.png[/img] [CENTER] [U][size=14pt]Download Information[/size][/U]
[I]Application Size: 146KB Total Size: 13.5MB Compressed Size: 16.1MB[/I] [B]Important Note:[/B] [I]High file size is due to the 20,694 Images used for items in the GUI of the editor.[/I]
Download Link: [url=https://rapidshare.com/files/3347332901/ZarporShopEditorV1.zip]https://rapidshare.com/files/3347332901/ZarporShopEditorV1.zip[/url] Mirror 1: [url=http://uppit.com/i7ganwietki4/ZarporShopEditorV1.zip]http://uppit.com/i7ganwietki4/ZarporShopEditorV1.zip[/url] [/CENTER]

item.dc:creator: @deads55 deads55
item.description:
@deads55 wrote:

when i click on a shop it says this: Unhandled exception has occurred in your application. If you click Continue, the application will ignore this error and attempt to continue. If you click Quit, the application will close immediately. Index was outside the bounds of the array.

What do i do???

Read full topic

item.title: [All] Advanced Shop Editor (Super Easy GUI - Edit everything in a shop)
item.dc:creator: @Faded.Fear Faded.Fear
item.description:
@Faded.Fear wrote:

[quote=“Zarpor, post:1, topic:442403”][CENTER][size=16pt]Introduction[/size][/CENTER]
Hello moparscape members. I have finally completed a project (Shop Editor) and am releasing it on here free to use. I don’t want anyone to post this anywhere else without my consent, which is why the program itself links to this thread. Please do not post any suggestions/bugs with the program in this thread. I have spent quite a bit of work on this and would definitely appreciate a thanks or any constructive comments. [Also posted on rune-server under the user “mattsforeal”]

[CENTER][size=14pt]Basic Features[/size][/CENTER]
Setting Up:
After you have downloaded and extracted the application and its configuration folder you will be able to open it up and start browsing for your server. Please take note that the configuration folder MUST be in the same directory as the application for this program to work properly. Go ahead and open it.

8zimpg.png500×516

Browse for the configuration folder of your server and hit OK.

The editor uses the following files:
• items.cfg - This tells the editor what ids and item names match up with an item in the shop.
• shops.cfg - This is the list of shops the shop editor is going to be changing.
• prices.txt - This is the file any price changes to items are going to be saved in format “ITEMID PRICE”
Note: Not all servers use prices.txt for item prices, if that is the case the editor will create the file and save the prices there anyway.

Selecting a shop and item:
Simply scroll through the list for the shop you want to edit and click on it to view the shop.
From here you can move, delete, add, or change amount or value of an item by clicking on an item in the shop.

Continuing on you can add items to the shop, all you have to do is select an item and click add before or add after.
A dialogue will pop up allowing you to search for items to add to the shop.

Double click the item you searched for to add it on Que. If you wish to remove an item from the Que list just double click on that.

When you think you are done with your shop click the “Hot Pink” Save button in the top right hand corner. The application will also prompt if you would like to save when you close it.

2m859uo.png501×517

[CENTER]
[size=14pt]Download Information[/size]

Application Size: 146KB
Total Size: 13.5MB
Compressed Size: 16.1MB
Important Note: High file size is due to the 20,694 Images used for items in the GUI of the editor.

Download Link: https://rapidshare.com/files/3347332901/ZarporShopEditorV1.zip
Mirror 1: http://uppit.com/i7ganwietki4/ZarporShopEditorV1.zip
[/CENTER][/quote]

Great job bro!
This is great for a quick shop update, and I love how it has all the item id’s and images.
This is great for a beginner and those who have coded for a while.
Just because the simplicity and the quickness of this.
+repped.

Read full topic
